file_content.text: You have enemies to hunt down. Get to your ship. I will brief you there.
Baras, are you responsible? Was it you who took out General Gonn?
It was, Lord Vengean. The fringe systems are now ripe for the taking.
Such an advantage will prod the rest of the Council out of passivity. They will see--war is the only answer.
You have delivered to me what I most crave.
Pardon the interruption, my lords.
Excuse me. [Bow]
Who is this, Baras?
My mightiest apprentice, my lord. And the killer of General Gonn.
And clearly a dutiful minion who knows the meaning of respect. Rise, young one. You have served your master and your master's master well.
I only did as I was told.
Give credit where credit is due.
It was I.
Who dares interrupt? Baras, who is this?
This is my most accomplished apprentice, my lord. And the killer of Gonn.
Your destruction of General Gonn earns you my favor, young one. Today.
I will eclipse the feat tomorrow, my lord.
Just the beginning.
I live in the moment, Vengean.
Good enough for me.
Good. Yet any moment may be your last, youngster.
[Remain quiet]
I will always serve you to the full extent of my abilities, master.
Who stands by eavesdropping? I do not like to be observed.
My lord, this is my most distinguished apprentice. And the deliverer of General Gonn's death.
I see. Funny you haven't mentioned this one. You, apprentice, by serving Baras, you serve me. Do you understand?
It is my privilege, master.
I live to serve.
I'm impressed with your choice of apprentice, Baras.
Yes.
Good.
As long as your purpose matches mine, we are in accord.
I'm in this for me.
How... amusing. Be sure you keep your boot on this one's neck, Baras.
It is time. I will send my destroyer to the fringe systems, and they will be mine before anyone is the wiser.
The order is given, Baras. Enact Plan Zero. Vengean out.
Excellent. I have waited a long time for this order.
Apprentice, Plan Zero is the systematic elimination of the Republic's top military leaders. A preemptive strike that will leave the enemy headless.
I like the sound of that.
Who are these walking corpses?
Give me my targets.
They are the Empire's most accomplished adversaries. And not to be taken lightly.
What kind of a war will it be with so crippled an enemy?
Where's the sport in that?
A short one, with a conclusive victory. That is the point.
I have been tracking the targets for years in anticipation of Plan Zero.
There's no time to waste. Make ready your ship. I will contact you there.
To Nar Shaddaa with you, apprentice. Before General Gonn goes back into his hole.
Ah, the latest lord in the Emperor's arsenal returns. You're just in time--I have need of you.
Ah, the latest lord in the Emperor's arsenal returns. I hear you've been busy fighting the Republic. Is that how you celebrate?
I go where the Empire needs me.
It's my duty.
While you were serving our Imperial allies, I came into some very valuable information.
Nothing reduces my stress better than battle.
I enjoyed every moment.
While you were reveling in the glory of battle, I came into some very valuable information.
Better than twiddling my thumbs.
Just passing time.
Well, while you attended to distractions, I came into some valuable information.
My master on the Dark Council, Darth Vengean, wants war. Not petty skirmishes that tiptoe around the Treaty of Coruscant, but open warfare.
Vengean has tasked me with finding a way to compel the rest of the Council to tear up the treaty.
The sooner we can stop pulling punches, the sooner the Republic will fall.
I'm all for that.
The Republic is stronger than you think, otherwise the Emperor would never have negotiated peace.
Surely, Sith don't need an excuse to war.
Shouldn't take much.
On the contrary, the Emperor himself gave the order for peace. It takes much to challenge that.
But I may have found an opportunity that will have the Council and the Emperor ready to act.
Does the task give you pause, master?
You sound conflicted.
The Emperor signed the treaty for a reason, but no, apprentice, I see it as a great opportunity.
I believe I have found a way to move the Dark Council and the Emperor happily toward war.
Most think that our inability to find and defeat one man--General Karastace Gonn--kept us from outright victory and forced the negotiated peace.
Tell me you've found this man, and that I get to kill him.
Then he must die.
I've never heard of Karastace Gonn.
Doesn't ring a bell.
Yes. Even as the Republic writes songs about him, we would just as soon forget he exists.
If one man can thwart the Empire, how do we show our faces in public?
How pathetic.
General Gonn operates from the shadows, a phantom single-handedly preventing the fringe systems from falling to us.
After years without a hint of his whereabouts, I've learned that he's meeting on Nar Shaddaa with traitorous Imperial agents. You will go there, and you will kill him.
Consider him dead.
Gladly.
What is this meeting about?
Traitorous agents?
He maintains the fringe systems by anticipating our moves. These traitors supply his information.
Anyone meeting with General Gonn is guilty of treason and must be eradicated. We will not appear weak on this.
I will punish all who are aligned with him.
Understood.
I'll assess the situation.
We'll see.
If you believe it is in your interest to display weakness--then by all means....
That this man eludes us and can turn our own is an embarrassment.
We already appear weak.
Then see to it that this weakness is not compounded.
Nothing cryptic about that.
Ordering his death is an act rife with political consequence. Take it seriously.
Without Gonn, the fringe systems will fall. Control of the outlying planets will be a great advantage.
So, to Nar Shaddaa. And deliver Darth Vengean's red carpet to war.
